intro: Craterostigma yaundense, commonly known as the Yaoundé craterostigma, is a rare flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features small, delicate leaves and produces clusters of pale yellow or white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
